intro: Melandrium longshoushanicum, commonly known as the Longshoushan catchfly, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
